definition: smokescreen/fig. a diversion
cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke
curtain or screen/canopy or tent/headquarters of a general/act (of a play)
smoke bomb
to spread a smokescreen

sentences.english: Smoke grenades are used for concealment while moving over open areas such as streets.
sentences.chinese: 煙幕彈用於開闊地或者街巷的隱蔽。

sentences.english: Pop some smoke and let me see your location.
sentences.chinese: 放煙幕彈，讓我找找你們的位置。

sentences.english: Riot police hurled tear gas canisters and smoke bombs into the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 防暴警察向人羣中投擲了催淚瓦斯罐和煙幕彈。
我想知道他們在放什麼煙幕彈。

sentences.english: Can be upgraded with hunter-killer missiles, searchlights, camo netting and smoke launchers.
sentences.chinese: 可裝備獵殺導彈，探照燈，僞裝網和煙幕彈。

sentences.english: Crick likens her departure to "the smoke of witchcraft" clearing from the group's eyes.
sentences.chinese: 克里克將她的離去比作消除團隊眼前的“巫術煙幕”。

sentences.english: Lighting fires to create a smoke screen is an ancient ruse in military tactics.
sentences.chinese: 生火製造煙幕，是古老的戰爭詭術。

sentences.english: Which animals vanish in a smoke screen?
sentences.chinese: 什麼動物會消失在“煙幕”裏？

sentences.english: A pall stretched for miles away from the island.
sentences.chinese: 一股煙幕延伸出島外達數英里之遙。

sentences.english: The smoke blackened the ceiling; The ceiling blackened.
Sexy question marks of smoke drifted up to the windows before vanishing.
sentences.chinese: 煙幕在消失之前形成了一個性感的問號。

sentences.english: When the smoke cleared, the mismatches started to emerge.
sentences.chinese: 當煙幕散盡後，開始出現失諧。

sentences.english: Our report draws the distinction between genuine debate and smokescreens, " Lambeck says.
sentences.chinese: 我們的報告意在區分真正的辯論和煙幕”，蘭貝克說。

sentences.english: It may also be a smokescreen.
sentences.chinese: 然而，這也可能僅僅只是個煙幕彈。

sentences.english: Smoke bombs were thrown during the street riots.
sentences.chinese: 街道上出現騷亂時投放了煙幕彈。

sentences.english: There was stage smoke and glitter grit on the runway.
sentences.chinese: 在展示臺上有舞臺煙幕和閃光的沙礫。

definition: lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence

Feast at Hongmen/(fig.) banquet set up with the aim of murdering a guest/refers to a famous episode in 206 BC when future Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] escaped attempted murder by his rival Xiang Yu 項羽|项羽[Xiang4 Yu3]
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
to shoot accidentally while polishing a gun/(fig.) a minor incident that sparks a war
to stir up public sentiment by false statements (idiom)/to resort to demagogy
to prevail upon/to coax
to tolerate is to nurture an evildoer (idiom); spare the rod and spoil the child
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
to force someone to do something
hard to distinguish real from imitation
harmony is to be prized
red in the face/extremely angry
to counter every move/to be full of tricks
time bomb
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
